body:
##About

A digital journalist with skills in data-driven investigation and visualisation, multimedia, SEO, SMO and journalism innovation. Favourite beats are Eastern European affairs, the media. Graduating from MA Interactive Journalism at City University London in July 2015.

##Work experience

**Data Journalism Intern, the Bureau of Investigative Journalism** _(Apr. 2015, London, UK)_: Pitched and implemented data visualisations based on the Drone Wars datasets. Here is [my blog post showcasing the visualisations I've done for TBIJ](http://bit.ly/1dSCpg5).

**Data Journalism Intern, the MediaBriefing** _(Jan. 2015, London, UK)_: Analysed scraped and crowdsourced data, produced visualisations, wrote follow-ups, e.g. [a story on shareability of content in major newsrooms](http://bit.ly/Buzzsocial).

**In-house Journalist at EPAM (NYSE:EPAM), IT Services** _(Apr. 2011 – Sep. 2014, Minsk, Belarus)_: Started data and video team; full-cycle production of infographics and video (idea generation, internal data analysis (Excel), script writing, project management, designers/video editors coordination); news, features, interviews; social presence for IT communities; meetup organisation. _Samples available upon request (corporate copyright); video sample [here](http://bit.ly/grandhack14)._

**Freelance Journalist, kyky.org** _(July 2012 – June 2013, Minsk, Belarus)_: Wrote features about technology, innovation, media for an online youth magazine.

**Literary Assistant, Peter R Cook** _(June – Sep. 2010, Provincetown, MA, USA)_: Conducted and wrote up interviews for documentaries about local communities.

##Education

**MA Interactive Journalism, City University London** _(Sep. 2014 – July2015, London, UK)_: Data journalism, social media and engagement, online journalism, media law, journalism innovation. Full scholarship (ESSYB).

**Undergraduate Degree in Translation (English/German/Russian), Belarusian State University** _(Sep. 2006 – June 2011, Minsk, Belarus)_: GPA 92%.

##Skills

* **Data journalism**: FOI, advanced search, scraping (OutwitHub, Scraperwiki, R, Python), data cleaning and analysis (Excel, OpenRefine), data visualisation (Tableau, Google Fusion, DataWrapper, RAW, CartoDB, etc.).
* **Online journalism**: SEO, interactive tools, photo, video (Adobe Premiere/Final Cut Pro), audio, curation, UGC, liveblogging, Markdown, CMS (Wordpress, Adobe CQ, Drupal, Ghost).
* **Social media and engagement**: Google Analytics, SMO (variety of analytical tools), content for social.
* **Web development**: HTML | Version control: Github
* **Community building**: meetup/workshop organisation, mentoring
* Agile project management of distributed teams

**Languages**: English – Advanced+, German – Upper Intermediate, Ukrainian – Advanced, Russian and Belarusian – native.

##Projects, awards and volunteering

Leader of **Hacks/Hackers Minsk** (since Jan 2014). [Find us on Facebook](http://bit.ly/hhminsk).

Special Commendation Prizes at two hackathons, team formula – **Build The News 2 and 3** (Oct 2014, March 2015). Check our [Save-my-Spot](http://bit.ly/1MOvdga) and [SitRep](http://bit.ly/1GiXS8e) projects on GitHub.

Volunteered at **International Journalism Festival** 2014 (Perugia); **MozFest** 2014, **Logan Symposium** 2014, **news:rewired** 2014 (London, UK).

Organised and conducted workshops on data journalism, e.g. Slideshare [presentation](http://slidesha.re/1ufIBES), webinar follow-up [blogpost](http://bit.ly/1FIwmS9); wrote tutorials, e.g. [GitHub for dummies](http://bit.ly/GitHubjourno).

## Advanced training and fellowships

* Math for Journalists MOOC (June 2015) by Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas/University of Texas at Austin, online
* M100 YEJ Workshop (Data Journalism) by Sanssouci Colloquium (Sep. 2014), Potsdam, Germany
* Journalism for Future Challenges programme (investigative journalism) by OCCRP (May 2014), Riga, Latvia
* Data Journalism Bootcamp by UNDP and Open Knowledge Foundation (Nov. 2013), Chisinau, Moldova
* Data-driven Journalism MOOC (Aug. – Sep. 2013) by Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas
* Infographics and Data Visualization MOOC (Jan. – Feb. 2013) by Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas
